We were visiting Aarhus and staying in Odder. On reviewing Horsens as a place of interest I stumbled upon The New Kronborg and the pictures of the delicious food sold it to me.(and the all inclusive pricing) 
They were offering a four course set menu, plus wine, coffee and liqueur for 500 KR (roughly ¬£60) or 300KR without drinks.
Upon arriving at 6.30pm, we were met by the Chef/Proprietor Kenneth who explained how the evening would run. The table was set beautifully with several glasses, a poured glass of Cava and a bread and oil selection. There was a "Wine buffet" with several wines which we could taste and refill our glasses at our leisure. Beer and soft drinks were also included in the package. Now I am not a wine connoisseur but do enjoy my wine tremendously and the selection was plentiful for the money paid. My partner who is not a regular wine drinker, enjoyed tasting the wines which ranged from a sweet German Riesling, a light Italian and a delightful Chardonnay. The reds included a Californian Zinfandel and a wonderful Syrah. There was also a lovely Rose Grenache which I enjoyed with my dessert. We discovered that the Danes like to drink Port with their dessert which was also available. 
As for the food, well where can I start..... just amazing! As the courses were brought to the table, Kenneth explained every one in detail. I adored this particular service and even though my partner and I are knowledgeable about most foods this was a lovely touch and would prove invaluable to others who were maybe not used to fine dining.
We had a salmon and dill appetizer with horseradish cream. A Veal and smoked bacon starter, a glorious duck main course which included the duck breast, confit of duck and some excellent parfait. Desert was sublime, and myself not having a particularly sweet tooth will often miss dessert. But boy was I glad I didn't miss this dessert of Almond cake with a set rice pudding and cherry sorbet. I fear my descriptions or posted photos do not do this food the justice it deserves. We finished with coffee/tea, some homemade biscuits, mints and a trolley selection of liqueurs of which I choose brandy, my partner having the Baileys. 
All in all a very memorable evening and should we ever return to the area this would be our first restaurant to revisit. I may just add that it was a very relaxed atmosphere, hence the non pretentious comment above. 
Thank you once again Kenneth and your team.
